references: , we provide the architectures for all the models used in our experiments, namely

, ResNet-18, and LeNet. In the non-Bayesian experiments, clients performed three local epochs with a batch size of 128 and a local learning rate of 0.1; while in the Bayesian experiments, they performed one local epoch. We conducted our experiments on NVIDIA Titan X GPUs on an internal cluster server, using 1 GPU per one run.
During non-i.i.d. data split, we choose the size of each clientâ€™s dataset
by first uniformly sampling an integer
is computed, representing the size of the local dataset
as a fraction of the full training dataset size. Moreover, we impose a maximum number of different labels, or classes,
, that each client can see. This way, highly unbalanced local datasets are generated.
